sec.p: Estimates of breeding density (number of breeding pairs per km 2) for the respective study sites were available only for the period 1994–2006 from reports by red-backed shrike ringers and observers of the Czech Shrike Working Group [51]. The ln-transformed estimates were however strongly correlated with the respective ln-transformed numbers of ringed broods per km 2 from our data (r = 0.81, p<0.001, n = 22). Therefore we used the ln-transformed number of ringed broods per km 2 available for all years as a proxy for annual conspecific density (“ln(density)” hereafter).
